title: Josh Mandel
added: Mandel is anti-abortion.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|title=PolitiFact - Former Ohio Gov. Ted Strickland raps Josh Mandel as a flip flopper on abortion, gay rights|url=https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2011/aug/16/ted-strickland/former-ohio-gov-ted-strickland-raps-josh-mandel-fl/|url-status=live|access-date=2021-02-18|website=@politifact|language=en-US}}</ref>

Mandel opposes same-sex marriage, saying in 2012 that he will "protect the sanctity of marriage" and "this is a fight that I will never, ever back down."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Koff|first=Stephen|date=2012-05-10|title=Same-sex marriage still breaks down along party lines for Ohioans in Congress|url=https://www.cleveland.com/open/2012/05/gay_marriage_still_breaks_down.html|url-status=live|access-date=2021-02-18|website=cleveland|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=July 17|first=Peter Rosenstein|last2=pm|first2=2012 at 3:17 pm EDT at 3:17|date=2012-07-12|title=Ohio GOP Senate candidate vows to fight against marriage equality|url=https://www.washingtonblade.com/2012/07/12/ohio-gop-senate-candidate-vows-to-fight-against-marriage-equality/|access-date=2021-02-18|website=Washington Blade: Gay News, Politics, LGBT Rights|language=en-US}}</ref> He is against gays serving in the military,<ref>{{Cite web|last=Zeiger|first=Asher|title=Jewish candidate blasted by relatives|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/jewish-gop-candidate-blasted-by-own-family/|access-date=2021-02-18|website=www.timesofisrael.com|language=en-US}}</ref> and voted against workplace and housing discrimination protections for gays and transgender individuals in 2009.<ref name=":0" />
